name: Sweet Country
description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

key_work.title: Sweet Country
key_work.creator_credit: Greer Simpkin, David Jowsey, David Tranter, Tony Cronin, Heather Wallace, Bunya Productions, Warwick Thornton and Steven McGregor
key_work.brief_description: It’s 1929 on the vast, desert-like, Eastern Arrernte Nation lands that are now known as the Central Australian outback. Sam Kelly, a middle-aged Aboriginal man, works the land of a kind preacher, Fred Smith. After an ill-tempered bully arrives in town and Kelly kills him in self-defence, he and his wife go on the run as a posse gathers to hunt him down.

constellations_primary.name: Sweet Country
constellations_primary.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

constellations_other.name: David Dalaithngu
constellations_other.description: David Dalaithngu was a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Dalaithngu was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge.

constellations_other.name: Crime doesn't pay
constellations_other.description: Ned Kelly's famous armour has appeared in many films, but the criminal myth speaks to how audiences have always been captivated by true-crime stories, from the beginning of cinema to today.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

start.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
start.brief_description: In 15th century France, a gypsy girl is framed for murder by the infatuated Chief Justice, and only the deformed bellringer of Notre Dame Cathedral can save her.

constellations_other.name: Sweet Country
constellations_other.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

end.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
end.brief_description: At the urging of his gargoyle pals, Quasimodo leaves the solitary safety of his Notre Dame tower against the wishes of his guardian, the evil Judge Claude Frollo. He ventures out to the Festival of Fools and finds his first true friend, a Romani woman named Esmeralda, who entrusts him with a secret. When the secret is revealed, Quasi soon finds himself fighting to save the people and city he loves.

constellations_other.name: Sweet Country
constellations_other.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

links.description: The Hunchback Of Notre Dame was one of the first classic Universal monster movies, with the Lon Chaney vehicle a huge hit for the studio. It was based on Victor Hugo’s 1831 novel, which was also the basis for the Disney musical The Hunchback Of Notre Dame.

start.title: Gargoyles
start.brief_description: Gargoyles is an American cartoon series produced by Disney Television Animation and Buena Vista Television that features Shakespearean themes.

constellations_other.name: Sweet Country
constellations_other.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

end.title: Get Out
end.creator_credit: Sean McKittrick, Jordan Peele, Edward H. Hamm Jr. 	 and Jason Blum

video_links.name: Get Out - In Theaters This February - Official Trailer

end.brief_description: Chris and his girlfriend Rose go upstate to visit her parents for the weekend. At first, Chris reads the family’s overly accommodating behavior as nervous attempts to deal with their daughter’s interracial relationship, but as the weekend progresses, a series of increasingly disturbing discoveries lead him to a truth that he never could have imagined.

constellations_other.name: Sweet Country
constellations_other.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

links.description: Despite being target at children, a cult fandom among adults has developed for Gargoyles due to its dark themes and high-concept premise. So much so, Get Out filmmaker Jordan Peele is developing a live-action reboot.

start.title: Get Out
start.creator_credit: Sean McKittrick, Jordan Peele, Edward H. Hamm Jr. 	 and Jason Blum

video_links.name: Get Out - In Theaters This February - Official Trailer

start.brief_description: Chris and his girlfriend Rose go upstate to visit her parents for the weekend. At first, Chris reads the family’s overly accommodating behavior as nervous attempts to deal with their daughter’s interracial relationship, but as the weekend progresses, a series of increasingly disturbing discoveries lead him to a truth that he never could have imagined.

end.title: Candyman
end.creator_credit: Jordan Peele, Win Rosenfeld, Ian Cooper, Universal Pictures, Creative Wealth Media Finance, Nia DaCosta, Brian Adler and Michael Furniss
end.headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 2020
end.brief_description: Anthony and his partner move into a loft in the now gentrified Cabrini-Green, and after a chance encounter with an old-timer exposes Anthony to the true story behind Candyman, he unknowingly opens a door to a complex past that unravels his own sanity and unleashes a terrifying wave of violence.

constellations_other.name: Sweet Country
constellations_other.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

links.description: Although better known for his sketch comedy, Peele became one of the most important filmmakers of his generation with Get Out. The film analysed race and racism in America, much like the predecessor to Candyman, whose sequel was written and produced by Peele.

start.title: Candyman
start.creator_credit: Jordan Peele, Win Rosenfeld, Ian Cooper, Universal Pictures, Creative Wealth Media Finance, Nia DaCosta, Brian Adler and Michael Furniss
start.headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 2020
start.brief_description: Anthony and his partner move into a loft in the now gentrified Cabrini-Green, and after a chance encounter with an old-timer exposes Anthony to the true story behind Candyman, he unknowingly opens a door to a complex past that unravels his own sanity and unleashes a terrifying wave of violence.

constellations_other.name: Sweet Country
constellations_other.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

end.title: Koyaanisqatsi
end.brief_description: Takes us to locations all around the US and shows us the heavy toll that modern technology is having on humans and the earth. The visual tone poem contains neither dialogue nor a vocalized narration: its tone is set by the juxtaposition of images and the exceptional music by Philip Glass.

constellations_other.name: Sweet Country
constellations_other.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

links.description: Candyman was directed by Nia DaCosta and follows in the legacy of the cult original, which featured a haunting score from composer Philip Glass. He evoked a surreal world of nature and humanity with his music on the film Koyaanisqatsi.

start.title: The Shape of Water
start.creator_credit: Guillermo del Toro and J. Miles Dale

video_links.name: THE SHAPE OF WATER | Red Band Trailer | FOX Searchlight
THE SHAPE OF WATER | Final Trailer | FOX Searchlight
THE SHAPE OF WATER | Official Trailer | FOX Searchlight

start.brief_description: An other-worldly story, set against the backdrop of Cold War era America circa 1962, where a mute janitor working at a lab falls in love with an amphibious man being held captive there and devises a plan to help him escape.

links.description: A monster film with a romance at its core, Guillermo Del Toro referenced another film with many of those same elements in The Shape Of Water. The Amphibian Man is tortured and chained on a circular platform that invokes a key scene with Quasimodo in The Hunchback Of Notre Dame.

constellations_other.name: Sweet Country
constellations_other.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

links.description: Sweet Country was based on the true story of Wilaberta Jack, who director and cinematographer Warwick Thornton had made a documentary about 10 years earlier. The feature was in competition at the Venice International Film Festival alongside The Shape Of Water.

start.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
start.brief_description: At the urging of his gargoyle pals, Quasimodo leaves the solitary safety of his Notre Dame tower against the wishes of his guardian, the evil Judge Claude Frollo. He ventures out to the Festival of Fools and finds his first true friend, a Romani woman named Esmeralda, who entrusts him with a secret. When the secret is revealed, Quasi soon finds himself fighting to save the people and city he loves.

end.title: Gargoyles
end.brief_description: Gargoyles is an American cartoon series produced by Disney Television Animation and Buena Vista Television that features Shakespearean themes.

constellations_other.name: Sweet Country
constellations_other.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

links.description: The Hunchback Of Notre Dame was Disney’s 34th animated feature. The inclusion of three comedic gargoyles in the film - voiced by Charles Kimbrough, Jason Alexander, and Mary Wickes - was said to be due to the popularity of another Disney animated property at the time: Gargoyles.
